intro: Didymoplexiella denticulata, commonly known as the toothed didymoplexiella, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
